The Next Step: Le Studio France
akas from release info: The Next Step: Academia de Dança Brazil
The Next Step: Le Studio France

1.title: Grave New World
1.plot: A-Troupe return to the Studio to see a completely new regime.

2.title: Wink It Out
2.plot: Piper feels as if she doesn't belong on A-Troupe anymore due to Angela's strict regime.

3.title: Dance-Zilla
3.plot: Richelle returns to the Studio in hopes of getting rid of Angela.

4.title: Coup d'Etat
4.plot: Richelle's plan to overthrow Angela is set in motion, as Kate returns to the Studio.

5.title: Summer Lovin'
5.plot: Michelle and Emily are reinstated as Studio Heads, and face their first challenge as Studio Heads

6.title: Mean Twirls
6.plot: Thalia returns to The Next Step, with her troupe, AcroNation.

1.title: Get the Party Started
1.plot: This introduces you to a dance studio called 'The Next Step', it has different groups due to your capability. Everyone in A or B troupe auditions for A troupe and there is a new girl what stirs the place up.

2.title: Everybody Dance Now
2.plot: The new A-Troupe team results in one top dancer losing their spot. Emily is fighting to keep her spot as Dance Captain.

3.title: Dance, Dance
3.plot: Kate and Chris give Michelle a chance to be dance captain considering her being dance captain at her last studio. Each dance captain had to split into a group of 5. But when Chris chooses the groups, Emily is split with Stephanie, her best friend, and Stephanie has to mess up the dance moves to Michelle's dance. Riley feels that Emily and Stephanie's idea shows that Emily is feeling too threatened towards Michelle. Kate yells at Michelle for deciding that their dance was ready, where Michelle argues saying that Stephanie agreed that she was ready. Emily was once again...

4.title: Rock and a Hard Place
4.plot: When mate asks Emily to hold dance evaluation placements in the group dance, Emily decides to put Michelle in the back row to cause waves amongst the dancers

5.title: Steal My Sunshine
5.plot: Steal My Sunshine is about... The A troupe members get a day off because of "Dance Camp" in studio A. Michelle gives out a idea that they can go to the beach (Michelle has never been). Since Emily is the dance captain, she is in charge of running "Dance Camp". The E~girls help her out. The rest of the troupe head down to the beach. Riley was wearing Emlily's grandmother's necklace to remember her loss. Riley had received a - watch and Emily a necklace it was the only thing they had to remember there grandmother by. Later on the day A huge problem happens including ...

6.title: Good Girls Go Bad
6.plot: To prepare for the competition, Emily convinces the team to go and spy on their arch enemies at Elite Dance Academy. Back at the studio, West and Daniel fight over studio space.

7.title: Love Story
7.plot: Emily agrees to go on a date with Eldon whilst Michelle is still at Elite making the only choice she has to pretend to audition for there team, Miss Kate is worried she will loose Michelle forever. James has a math test

8.title: Just the Two of Us
8.plot: Eldon struggles to choose between Emily and Michelle as his partner for his duet performance. Meanwhile, West and Stephanie are at odds on how to proceed with their duet, leaving West wanting to quit altogether.

9.title: Video Killed the Radio Star
9.plot: The A-Troupe is selected to perform in a music video for the band Brighter Brightest. However, the dancers become divided over the routine that Emily has choreographed.

10.title: Road to Joy
10.plot: In an effort to spend more time with Riley, James accompanies her to pick up costumes for the troupe. At the studio, Stephanie takes part in a photo shoot.

11.title: Can You Keep a Secret?
11.plot: Michelle learns the truth about Chloe's financial situation. The dancers compete for the solo spot in the Regionals routine.

12.title: Get It Together
12.plot: Michelle secretly choreographs a new routine for Regionals. When Michelle begins recruiting some of the A-Troupe to learn her routine, she missteps by inviting one of the E-Girls.

13.title: Don't Go Breaking My Heart
13.plot: Emily beings to suspect Michelle is up to something behind her back. Eldon gets tired of people questioning his relationship with Emily, and decides to set the story straight.

14.title: Sabotage
14.plot: Emily and Michelle's battle for leadership comes to a head when Kate learns that Michelle has choreographed a different routine for Regionals.

15.title: Changes
15.plot: Emily and Stephanie have trouble adjusting to life in the studio with Michelle as Dance Captain. Michelle's captaincy is tested when James' Mom tells A-Troupe that James has to stop dancing to focus on his studies.

16.title: Help
16.plot: Michelle decides to change the line positions and neither Emily nor Stephanie are happy about it. Emily confesses a secret to Eldon that brings them a little closer.

17.title: Forget You
17.plot: Emily struggles with what to do next after being put in the back row by Michelle and accuses Michelle of having a crush on Eldon. Stephanie's first audition doesn't go exactly as planned.

18.title: Brand New
18.plot: With Emily and Stephanie gone, Giselle auditions to be the new member of A-Troupe. Riley offers to help James learn the routine he's missing since he's not in the studio.

19.title: First Date
19.plot: Riley goes on her first date with James.

20.title: We Are Family
20.plot: Riley tries to make amends with her sister, but it doesn't go exactly as planned. Eldon struggles with the feelings he has for both Michelle and Emily.

21.title: Break Stuff
21.plot: Giselle wants to make her mark in A-Troupe by doing a dangerous lift, but Daniel isn't so sure it is a good idea. Michelle thinks it's exactly what they need to get them to Regionals and wants to help them, against Kate and Chris's wishes.

22.title: Come Back... Be Here
22.plot: With Daniel now out of A-troupe, Michelle and the team try and get Emily to come back. James is given Daniel's solo, but can't seem to balance both math and dance and Riley and West worry he may get pulled out of the studio for good.

23.title: Dancing in the Street
23.plot: When A-Troupe get themselves into a dance battle with the street crew, "Seeds", West has no choice but to reveal his secret. Michelle learns that being Dance Captain is harder than she thought.

24.title: Price Tag
24.plot: Chloe's financial problems finally boil over and she is forced to leave A-Troupe. Michelle and Emily decide to be Co-Captains and choreograph a new routine.

25.title: Bad Moon Rising
25.plot: Since everyone has been working so hard in prep for Regionals, Kate and Chris hold a pizza party at The Next Step studio. Everyone has a good time getting to hang out as friends, and not just dance mates.

26.title: Can't Fight This Feeling
26.plot: The dancers are excited when their Regional costumes arrive, but when they realize they are wrong, everyone worries they may not have them in time. Eldon tries to talk to Michelle, but when she continues to ignore him, he decides to move on for good.

27.title: I'm So Excited
27.plot: The A-Troupe finally head to Regionals. When West learns that Seeds may not be able to perform, he volunteers to step in and help them out.

28.title: Fancy Footwork
28.plot: The Next Step takes the stage for the first time in their bid to win Regionals. When Riley has trouble with a part of her costume, The Next Step's chances are jeopardized.

29.title: This Is How We Do It
29.plot: After being named the wild card they are put through to the semifinals. Where they dance against rival dance troupe seeds, who they previously lost to in a dance battle. So will they win and face Elite in the final.

30.title: Winner Takes All
30.plot: The Next Step studio battles the Elite Dance Academy as the final two groups at Regionals.

1.title: Don't Stop the Party
1.plot: The A-Troupe is reunited after their win at Regionals but they learn quickly that the rules at Nationals are different and their team dynamic could be in jeopardy. Emily and Michelle set aside their differences over Eldon and agree to focus their energies on the Nationals preparation.

2.title: My Boyfriend's Back
2.plot: A-Troupe meets their new choreographer and votes for open auditions for the Nationals Team. A-Troupers, B-Troupers, J-Troupers plus unexpected newcomers all show up for the Nationals team auditions.

3.title: Ready to Start
3.plot: The first round of auditions for the Nationals team takes place. Phoebe, the new Head Choreographer, challenges the dancers with her choreography for the final round.

4.title: The Final Cut
4.plot: The Nationals team is chosen with devastating results for some A-Troupers. Hunter enlists Emily's help to make Michelle jealous.

5.title: The Girl Is Mine
5.plot: Hunter challenges Eldon to a secret dance battle - the prize -Michelle. Kate asks James to dance a duet with Beth when her partner drops out.

6.title: Work It
6.plot: With new members in place, the team fundraises to buy designer uniforms. Michelle is confused when Eldon avoids her as a result of losing the dance battle.

7.title: It Takes Two
7.plot: Solos and duets competitors are chosen for Nationals, where each round is an elimination. Michelle is hurt when Eldon won't do the duet with her. Riley's world comes crashing down when James betrays her.

8.title: What I'll Do
8.plot: Auditions for the small group dance are held amid personal betrayals and misunderstandings. James apologizes to Riley but she cannot bring herself to forgive him.

9.title: Never Enough
9.plot: James and Riley struggle with their duet. Michelle confronts Eldon for an answer as to why he is avoiding her.

10.title: I Hope I Get It
10.plot: As the studio grows in popularity it must make space for new members of J-Troupe. Emily asks Hunter to help her with J-Troupe auditions to make Michelle jealous but enjoys herself with Hunter more than she expects.

11.title: Anything You Can Do, I Can Do Better
11.plot: Michelle and Amanda promote the studio at their school while the others mentor J-troupe. Daniel gives Kate an ultimatum if he doesn't get the solo for Nationals.

12.title: Time to Move On
12.plot: The Next Step perform their nationals finals routine against Life of Dance with Amanda from Elite although they win after going back to the studio to practise they receive disturbing news and a big catastrophe and decision as Lucien gives them a proposition to consider.

13.title: The Truth Comes Out
13.plot: Michelle finds out about the dance battle and Hunter gets a chance at the Nationals solo spot. Phoebe challenges select A-Troupers and J-Troupers to create a song and a dance in 24 hours.

14.title: Sing
14.plot: Michelle holds a scholarship fundraiser for young dancers while the Elite competition gets a step up. Amanda misses a band practice and feels bad about lying to her new friends. West and Giselle get caught up in a talent war.

15.title: You're the One That I Want
15.plot: Giselle and Thalia think a little competition will be good motivation for James and Riley. Hunter invites Michelle to a concert. James and Eldon do some male bonding while Amanda sympathizes with Emily.

16.title: Hazy Shade of Winter
16.plot: Michelle confronts Emily about the kiss. Thalia and Giselle try to convince James and Riley to take the duet back. Hunter's confused and Michelle has something important to discuss with Kate.

17.title: Game On
17.plot: The pressure is on for Nationals when a key member leaves the troupe. The team can't afford to lose anyone else. Amanda and Riley audition for the solo while Emily puts herself on the line to save her team.

18.title: Make a Plan to Love Me
18.plot: In order to win Riley back, James suggests she give him a list of tasks to complete to prove his dedication, starting with breaking up with Beth. Emily further isolates herself from the team to gain Amanda's trust. When Michelle won't answer calls from the studio, Chloe visits Michelle at School.

19.title: Sacrifice
19.plot: Emily encourages Hunter to try to get closer to the boys. James creates a new dance move for Riley's list. Gabi is jealous when her younger sister, Becca, is chosen for a J-Troupe trio.

20.title: Heartbreaker
20.plot: Emily faces a difficult situation to prove her trip to Amanda. James continues to tick off challenges from Riley's list.

21.title: Hello Trouble
21.plot: Thalia, Giselle, and Amanda represent The Next Step at a Trio competition. When Michelle comes to watch, Amanda is forced to change her plans. James tackles number ten on Riley's list and decides to get to know Emily.

22.title: Lost
22.plot: James turns to the boys for help to solve a riddle for Riley. The A-Troupe costumes for Nationals go missing. Emily's loyalties are tested.

23.title: Better Than This
23.plot: James is closer to finishing Riley's list. Amanda continues to scheme and is suspicious of Emily's motives. Michelle tries to find a substitute for dance.

24.title: Under Pressure
24.plot: While Amanda's plans to take down The Next Step involve Chloe, James and Riley are off to learn First Aide. Emily is worried she will never collect enough evidence to show Amanda's true colors.

25.title: Just Dance
25.plot: Chloe and Riley work together to prove Emily is innocent. A-Troupe are reeling after Amanda's shock confession.

26.title: Water It
26.plot: With Nationals around the corner, Riley and James struggle to reconnect while rehearsing their duet. Emily and West strike up an unlikely friendship, while Michelle and Eldon rekindle theirs.

27.title: Run This Town
27.plot: Successful choreographer Luther Brown drops in on The Next Step to help the boys with their small group routine. Thalia and Giselle are in a rush to try to teach Michelle the Nationals routine. James gives Eldon dating advice.

28.title: Re-Match
28.plot: The team arrives at Nationals for the first of two dates of male solo competition. Both Elite and Ladies of Destruction (LOD) appear as formidable opponents.

29.title: Old Friends
29.plot: Eldon learns he must compete against Daniel in the male solo round. Daniel's competitiveness stains his friendships with his old teammates.

30.title: I Don't Know
30.plot: Small Groups and duets compete at the Nationals competition. James struggles with whether to include a challenging move in the small group routine.

31.title: What Are You Waiting For?
31.plot: Michelle is pitted against Amanda in the female solo round. Elite tries to sabotage Michelle's chances to dance and Amanda wonders why her team lacks confidence in her ability to win.

32.title: You Love Me
32.plot: It's semi-finals, the team showcases their dance that reflects the studio code, the team is stronger with all its individuals. West charms Emily with how he sees her. The dance comes to a devastating end.

33.title: Rewind
33.plot: It's the finals, but The Next Step only has 9 dancers, as Emily has injured her knee. Amanda volunteered to dance in her place, but what will the judges decide?

34.title: What Dreamers Do (Extended)
34.plot: The team awaits a verdict to see if Emily can dance or whether the team has to forfeit.

1.title: Coming Home?
1.plot: The Next Step must find a new studio, but will Julian get in their way? Meanwhile, James helps plan his aunts wedding.

2.title: Game, Set and Match
2.plot: Miss Kate makes an agreement with Lucien, to try and save the Studio. The A-troupe members have to compete against both dancers from the Elite team, and their own teammates, if they want a spot on the International teams.

3.title: Secrets
3.plot: Lucien continues with his plot to destroy The Next Step, and he has recruited Daniel to Elite to help him. Emily gets news about her knee, while Michelle struggles with some personal stuff.

4.title: Let the Games Begin
4.plot: It's The Next Step against Elite. The competition for spots at the Internationals team begins, and all the dancers try their best to get on the team.

5.title: The Fallout
5.plot: James and Riley struggle with competing against etch other, Miss Kate makes a decision regarding the future of The Next Step, while the boys says goodby to Hunter.

6.title: The Times They Are a Changin'
6.plot: The dans-battle continues. With five dans-battles left, The Next Step is in the lead, with four dancers from TNS on the Internationals team, which means they only need three more to keep the Studio, and get rid of Lucien.

7.title: Your New Beginning
7.plot: The new A-Troupe struggles to cooperate.

8.title: I'm Your Captain
8.plot: James enlists Riley's help finding a suit for his aunt Kathy's wedding.

9.title: The Nutcracker Prince
9.plot: Eldon challenges West to broaden his dance horizons and audition for a ballet company. West enlists Chloe's help to support him through the audition. James is busy with the band, and isn't sure if he'll take the open spot on A-Troupe.

10.title: Can't Fight This Feeling
10.plot: Thalia gets jealous and wonders if things between Michelle and Eldon are really over. Chloe receives an exciting opportunity to help her dance career, but taking it would mean leaving The Next Step. Richelle develops a crush on a member of ATroupe.

11.title: Marry Me
11.plot: James driving instructor:Arthuer wants to marry his aunt Kathy to become his actual uncle. At first James dosn't like Arthur but soon starts to love him but Arthur has to choose between Kathy or his cats will James save the wedding

12.title: Do the Right Thing
12.plot: Chloe chooses between joining a ballet company and staying at The Next Step. Fed up with Eldon avoiding her, Thalia gets to the bottom of his odd behaviour.

13.title: Put You First
13.plot: James and Riley struggle to find the perfect anniversary gift for each other. Giselle and Thalia question Amanda's place in a trio when Max offers to help. Eldon, West, and Cierra discover that Noah has superhuman abilities, and put him to the test.

14.title: I Hope I Get It
14.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

15.title: The New Girl in Town
15.plot: The team are in for surprises when Ella comes to the studio.

16.title: Sweet Spot
16.plot: Riley and James are assigned a duet for Internationals. While James is busy with his band, Ella challenges Riley to have some fun rather than wait around for him. Eldon helps Thalia with her quest to find EURoesweet spotsEUR in the studio.

17.title: Square Dance
17.plot: In an effort to help ease tension as Internationals approaches, Riley and Ella trick A-Troupe into learning a square dance. Feeling left out, Noah struggles to bring his dancing to the next level.

18.title: Mixed Messages
18.plot: Thalia and Eldon find new ways of communicating in secret.

19.title: Never There
19.plot: Ella tries to show Noah that he belongs in A-Troupe.

20.title: Cry Me a River
20.plot: Noah challenges Eldon's selection as the international soloist.

21.title: Today I'm Getting Over You
21.plot: Cierra's dedication to dance creates problems with Skylar.

22.title: It's My Party
22.plot: West and Giselle help Eldon and Thalia's budding romance.

23.title: Welcome to Miami
23.plot: In Miami for internationals, Riley is forced to work as a waitress after she is unable to pay for her meal; West gives a guided tour to some of the more offbeat attractions Miami has to offer.

24.title: Lost at Sea
24.plot: Kate and Giselle arrive to register for Internationals, but James hasn't signed his form yet. Unfortunately, James is trapped on a boat, adrift in the middle of the alligator-filled Everglades with West and Eldon.

25.title: When the War Is Over
25.plot: Eldon struggles with the loss of his lucky coin ahead of his Mister International Soloist competition. Riley's friendship with Ella is tested when they compete for Miss International Soloist.

26.title: We Are the World
26.plot: Thalia is selected to represent The Next Step in the first round of Internationals, which sees dancers from different countries team up. Eldon suspects Thalia's new teammate from Poland is interested in more than just dance.

27.title: Blind
27.plot: The dancers find out that in the second round of Internationals, the dance they had prepared will have to be performed blindfolded. As they struggle to make it work, it becomes apparent that they need to change which dancers perform. Michelle helps Stephanie conquer her stage fright.

28.title: Turn, Turn, Turn
28.plot: Eldon competes to earn his teams time to prepare for the next round.

29.title: She's Not You
29.plot: A key dancer's sudden illness threatens the team's chance to move on to the finals.

30.title: How It Ends
30.plot: The Next Step battles for the title of international champion against the team from Sweden; James and Riley put everything on the line to give their team a chance at winning.

1.title: One More Time
1.plot: Miss Kate and the A-Troupe dancers hold an open house for prospective new dancers wishing to attend the studio. James is surprised to see a familiar face at the open house.

2.title: Stir It Up
2.plot: A-Troupe auditions begin amidst big decisions for two key characters. In an attemptto prevent future arguements, Skylar and Cierra make a pact.

3.title: Heads Will Roll
3.plot: At the afternoon auditions, guest choreographer Stephanie has her last dance at The Next Step. Alfie helps the nervous new dancers relax before their auditions. Cierra and Skylar's pact is tested when the sisters face the most challenging audition of their lives.

4.title: Welcome to the Jungle
4.plot: The new A-troupe dancers are revealed, and Piper decides to form a club with her nervous fellow newbies. Riley is offered the opportunity of a lifetime, and Cierra and Amanda both vie for the final open spot on A-Troupe.

5.title: Square One
5.plot: Riley decides to assign a trio competition to prepare for the first Regionals qualifier. Amanda and Michelle are threatened by Richelle's superior dance skills. Nervous about her limitations as a dancer, Sloane turns to her best friend LaTroy for support.

6.title: London Calling
6.plot: West receives a mysterious package from London, England, which leads to a big surprise for the bros. Noah takes a break from dance to work on his music in Studio-A, and enlists the help of a reluctant Amanda. Reeling from her humiliation in the trio competition, Sloane seeks help from the Zero Percent Club.

7.title: Walk This Way
7.plot: As James prepares to leave for London, an overwhelmed Riley wonders if she's taken on too much as the head of the studio. Michelle and Cassie challenge Henry and LaTroy to teach them some new hip-hop tricks. A smitten Amanda helps Noah with a family matter.

8.title: Runaway
8.plot: Riley learns that Alfie is hiding a big secret, and his future at The Next Step is in jeopardy. James, West, and Eldon arrive in London, England for the Bangers & Mashups International Hip-Hop Extravaganza.

9.title: Dancing with Myself
9.plot: Noah's rehearsal prompts a discussion about which trio should be showcased to represent The Next Step. Meanwhile, Michelle wants Alfie to help her bolster her concentration skills on the dance floor; and Sloane gets pranked by Amy and Cassie.

10.title: Simple Twist of Fate
10.plot: A-Troupe performs at the qualifier. Meanwhile, a nervous Amanda wants to let Noah know how she feels about him; Noah conceals his back injury; and Sloane tries to lift everyone's spirits by throwing a bash at the studio.

11.title: On the Rocks
11.plot: A-Troupe perform[s] at the qualifier. Meanwhile, a nervous Amanda wants to let Noah how she feels about him; Noah conceals his back injury; and Sloane tries to lift everyone's spirits by throwing a bash at the studio.

12.title: Knowing Me, Knowing You
12.plot: Noah invites Amanda on a pre-date, and she seizes the opportunity to figure out his true feelings for her. LaTroy and Sloane get into a fight after he receives an invitation he can't refuse. Riley asks the dancers to review each other, but things don't go as planned.

13.title: The Game Belongs to Me
13.plot: Michelle's competitive side is on full display when she's pitted against Piper. LaTroy seeks out Amy's help to be the best dancer he can be. Riley chooses the five dancers that will compete in the qualifier.

14.title: I Can't Go for That
14.plot: Riley gets invited to an exclusive gala, and has to decide who to invite as her date. Skylar struggles to find her place on A-Troupe. LaTroy discovers that Henry has used his name in an unusual way.

15.title: I Only Have Eyes for You
15.plot: Amy makes LaTroy a proposition, but things get complicated when Sloane discovers new feelings; West and Eldon have an adventure in London.

16.title: Love Will Tear Us Apart
16.plot: Michelle and Riley have a lunch date and take a walk down memory lane. Noah, afraid of losing his spot on A-Troupe, continues to hide his back troubles.

17.title: Nobody's Fault But Mine
17.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

18.title: Your Time Is Gonna Come
18.plot: James, Eldon, and West compete in the first round of the Bangers & Mashups Hip-Hop Extravaganza in London.

19.title: How Deep Is Your Love?
19.plot: Alfie considers Noah's health problems and surprises Riley with a plan for the qualifiers. Meanwhile, Amanda and Noah open up to one another; and LaTroy makes an unexpected decision in the wake of receiving news from his dad.

20.title: Heat of the Moment
20.plot: When Noah receives a devastating diagnosis, auditions for the qualifier duet become more important than ever.

21.title: Kiss and Tell
21.plot: Piper struggles to keep the fact that she saw Riley and Alfie kiss to herself. Henry teaches Amanda a secret skill. Amy and Sloane get assigned an uncomfortable task.

22.title: Rumour Has It
22.plot: Piper gives Riley an ultimatum to tell James about her kiss with Alfie. Cassie has trouble looking on the bright side of things. Theo from Lost & Found helps Amanda deal with her fears about Noah's operation.

23.title: Here Comes Your Man
23.plot: Amanda's cousin Cooper shows up to visit The Next Step Studio. Noah struggles with Amanda seeing him at his weakest. Thalia surprises Eldon by showing up in London. James comes home because he is concerned about Piper.

24.title: Tainted Love
24.plot: Riley tells James about the kiss. West and Eldon battle at the Bangers and MashUps competition in London. Noah and Amanda struggle with the next step in their relationship.

25.title: A Fool in Love
25.plot: Riley asks James for some space to sort out her feelings for Alfie. Amy tries to help LaTroy deal with being alone at the farm. Cassie helps Skylar deal with her fear of talking to strangers.

26.title: Come Together
26.plot: Riley helps the team get ready for competition by doing anti-bullying exercises. Everyone learns the different types of bullying behavior and how to deal with it.

27.title: Karma Police
27.plot: Emily shows up to help Riley get The Next Step to Regionals. Emily tries to get to the bottom of the problem with the Qualifier duet. Riley makes a decision about her relationship with James. Amy tries to help Sloane reconnect with LaTroy.

28.title: Only You
28.plot: Emily and Riley choose a Dance Captain. Noah struggles with being reassigned the Qualifier duet. Sloane helps Jude from Lost & Found with his music video.

29.title: Danger Zone
29.plot: Riley asks James for an impossible favour for the studio. Skylar helps the zero percenters deal with their nerves. James and Alfie have a heated conversation.

30.title: Rivalry
30.plot: As Michelle came to the next step so did drama it is be harder than ever to get everyone to work together will the get to regionals or will they be torn down

31.title: Nobody's Perfect
31.plot: Riley and Alfie have their first date and it does not go well. Noah takes a big step in his relationship with Amanda. Michelle is so focussed on her solo, she disappoints her trio teammates.

32.title: Shake It Off
32.plot: James, West and Eldon continue to compete at Banger and Mashups in London. Meanwhile, Noah and Richelle prepare a duet with the helps of an old A-Troupe member.

33.title: It Ain't Easy
33.plot: James meets an old friend in London. Riley is confused by her feelings towards Alfie. LaTroy returns from time with his father and turns to Sloane to sort out his feelings.

34.title: Bold as Love
34.plot: Alfie asks Riley to go on a trip, and she does, but not where he planned. Meanwhile, Eldon, West and James compete in the finals at the Bangers and Mashups International Hip Hop Competition.

35.title: Taking Care of Business
35.plot: James and Riley return to the studio, only to discover that a team member has left. West and Eldon help the small group with their choreography. Riley struggles with confiding with James about studio issues, now that they have reunited.

36.title: The Edge of Glory
36.plot: The team prepares to leave for Regionals. Cassie is made the alternate dancer but still tries to help the team. Giselle drops by on a break from her tour and gives Amanda a special invitation. LaTroy spends time with both Sloane and Amy.

37.title: Even Better Than the Real Thing
37.plot: The team competes in the first round at Regionals. Due to a misreading of the rules, the solo round is not what they expected. The result is devastating. Tanisha Scott co-hosts the SNR broadcast with Chuck Anderson.

38.title: Don't Stop Me Now
38.plot: The Next Step competes in the sudden death trio round. Michelle pushes herself before the trio dance in order to be ready. Amanda struggles with the offer from Giselle. The Geminis continue to win every round.

39.title: Livin' on a Prayer
39.plot: The team competes in the duet round and if they win, they go to semi-finals. With Sloane disqualified and Michelle injured, The Next Step does not have enough dancers to dance in the final, if they make it there. Amanda makes her decision. James supports The Next Step in a way no one would expect.

40.title: A Change Is Gonna Come
40.plot: Now that Alfie is back, the team is able to compete in the Regionals final. But when Michelle shows up ready to dance, Riley has to make a heart-breaking decision and side-line one of the dancers who was about to compete. LaTroy makes a decision he has been dreading. With several team members broken hearted, The Next Step leaves it all on the floor in the final.

1.title: A New Regime
1.plot: A new group of dancers audition for A-Troupe, with a new Studio Head, will A-Troupe be the same?

2.title: Go West, Young Michelle
2.plot: Michelle makes a surprising announcement which tears TNS in half. TNS West, Michelle and West's Team TNS East, Emily and Daniel's Team

3.title: Dance, Lies and Hoverboards
3.plot: A self-trained dancer, Kingston, must prove himself to keep his spot on Michelle's new troupe. Over at TNS East, Richelle gets a pleasant surprise, and questions the motives of a new dancer Lola, who seems intent on becoming her best friend. Since Amy never told her mom she was cut from A-Troupe, she needs Piper's help to cover for her.

4.title: Leon Me
4.plot: TNS East hires a guest choreographer, Leon Blackwood, to teach a Hip Hop workshop. But when TNS West shows up to join in, the divide between the two troupes grows even deeper. As Noah and Jacquie's connection becomes obvious, Henry is forced to make a tough decision.

5.title: It's All Fun and Games
5.plot: After being assigned a duet, Noah struggles to find the chemistry on stage with Richelle because of his feelings for Jacquie. LaTroy, Henry, and Amy try to play a prank on Ozzy, who teaches his teammates a lesson. Amy's mom discovers that Amy has been lying about being on A-Troupe, and Amy's worst fears may come true.

6.title: No Good Deed
6.plot: Piper tried to get Amy on TNS East, but it turns out expectedly.

7.title: Heathers
7.plot: Piper discovers a dancer to bring to TNS West, which reveals a shocking secret. Jacquie questions her relationship with Noah.

8.title: 12 Hour Party People
8.plot: Michelle and Piper organise a Dance-athon, featuring old A-Troupe Members

9.title: A Tale of Two Eldons
9.plot: Eldon returns when Emily asks him to teach TNS East choreography, but what will happen when Michelle asks Eldon to choreograph for TNS West.

10.title: United and Divided
10.plot: Noah resolves his problems with Henry while he resolves his problems with Jacquie. Piper reveals a shocking truth to Michelle and West.

11.title: East Meets West
11.plot: TNS East and TNS West finally battle to see who goes to Regionals.

12.title: Brave New World
12.plot: Kingston and Ozzy think there's something suspicious about Elliot's generosity, and discover he's hiding a shocking secret. LaTroy is given the opportunity of a lifetime, but if he chooses to take it, it will mean leaving the studio. In the wake of the results of the dance battle, Noah and Jacquie struggle with the fact that only one of them can go to Regionals.

13.title: TNS: Civil War
13.plot: Miss Kate makes a horrifying announcement which threatens the future of TNS East and TNS West.

14.title: Stand Together or Fall Apart
14.plot: Piper and Amy try to merge TNS East and TNS West. Jacquie get a tempting offer from Skylar.

15.title: This Changes Everything
15.plot: The Merged Troupe show Miss Kate their dance, in hopes of getting back to Regionals.

16.title: Stand and Deliver
16.plot: Emily and Michelle decide that A-Troupe needs a Dance Captain, Richelle makes sure she is.

17.title: Oh Brother! Why Art Thou Here?
17.plot: After losing her Dance Captaincy, Richelle has to win the Hip-Hop against Zara and Jacquie

18.title: I Have a Vision
18.plot: A last-second change of plans threatens The Next Step's chances at qualifying for Regionals, and Ozzy struggles to step up to the challenge. When Richelle encounters a difficult hurdle, Lola feels pressure to stay loyal to her friend. Piper is surprised by some new feelings for an old friend.

19.title: Snap Decision
19.plot: Lola and Richelle's friendship is threatened when Lola tries to keep Richelle from making the biggest mistake of her life. Noah's role as dance captain puts him at odds with Jacquie, and puts pressure on their relationship. Ozzy is terrified he has ruined the team's shot at Regionals.

20.title: Pointe of No Return
20.plot: TNS is recording its Regionals qualifier video. With the deadline imminent, everything must go according to plan. Richelle makes a horrifying discovery that could ruin the video and put her dance career at risk. As Piper's feelings for a fellow dancer grow, she works up the courage to ask him out.

imdb.title: The Next Step
plot: As the A-Troupe dancers prepare for the regional dance competition, relationships and loyalties are put to the test at the Next Step studio.::Temple Street Productions
